case_vignette: A 55-year-old male with past medical history of Jewish ancestry presents with painful oral lesions and few "waterboils" on the arms for the past three months! His only medications include multivitamin and atorvastatin which he has been on for the past 15 years without any dosage changes! He denies any recent travel or genital uclers! A full skin examination is remarkable for irregularly shaped erosions of the buccal and palatine mucosa and scattered flaccid bullae on the arms with few scattered crusted erosions! A biopsy of a bulla on the arm is performed and demonstrates suprabasilar acantholysis with vertically oriented basal keratinocytes with the acantholysis involving hair follicles!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have painful sores in my mouth and some "waterboils" on my arms.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For the past three months.
Do you have any other symptoms such as fever, joint pains, or vision changes?
No, I do not have any other symptoms like fever, joint pains, or vision changes.
Have you started any new medications or do you have any known allergies?
I have not started any new medications, and I don't have any known allergies.
Do the sores in your mouth or on your arms occur after eating certain foods or during periods of stress?
No, the sores do not occur after eating certain foods or during periods of stress.
Have you had any prior episodes like this, or is this the first occurrence?
This is the first occurrence of these symptoms.
Do you have a family history of similar symptoms or any autoimmune diseases?
I don't have a family history of similar symptoms or any autoimmune diseases.
Final Diagnosis: Pemphigus Vulgaris.
